ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Better researching process. Greater understanding of the intention behind the components of a research study.  Communicating my ideas and intentions with greater clarity.
I learned how to plan for and complete an EDST capstone prospectus (essentially, first half of your capstone) and how to complete an IRB application.
IRB application, developing a strong methodology, research skills, creating a strong literature review

Big picture: writing a research paper, a very strong research paper. They broke down the entire process. And took the time to explain how I write a strong literature review, how to develop a a strong and focused research question , honestly best breakdown and guidance through a long term research project I've experienced

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The module process with expected deliverables each week was extremely helpful and allowed me to see the evolution of my thought process and map my progress. Peer discussions particularly leaving comments on each others work was extremely helpful and it was awesome to read about other peoples passions as well.

Strengths: TZB and the edst team give such great, comprehensive feedback for every stage of your writing. The class community is very helpful for motivation and accountability. The class is structured so that you receive such a clear path forward and a clear understanding of expectations.

I think only thing to be mindful of is that you are going to get so much feedback from different ppl that it may seem overwhelming. Remember that this is a good thing, and really time block the time you spend with your capstone so you dont drown in it.

Strengths: built in time for capstone work, great organization and opportunity to try different topics 

Weaknesses: clearer feedback between professor and advisor

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! The Education Studies department has an incredible faculty and the best classes at Yale.

Yes!! If youre an EDST scholar you have to take this, but I truly cant imagine having a better start to the capstone / thesis writing process. The process to decide on your topic is great, and it ensures that you really leave with something youre passionate about. I cant say enough about the way that this class is set up, I feel like I have such a clear idea of whats expected and how to get there. It makes the page-length ultimately required feel so much less daunting. I feel very lucky to have done this class before starting the thesis process for my major, which it does not seem like offers nearly as much comprehensive advising.
Yes! Very helpful for building project
